business.headline: Sensex, Nifty close lower in a choppy session; IT and metal stocks weighThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 67.30 points to close at 78,472.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 23.35 points to end at 23,730.10.

18% GST on used cars: Do you have to pay tax on selling your car?The decision has sparked debates as it comes at a time when India's used car market is poised for growth. Many believe the move aims to tap into the rapidly expanding sector to boost government revenue.
Tata Capital IPO buzz? All you need to knowIf the IPO goes through, it will be the Tata Group's second public offering in two decades. The last one was Tata Technologies' IPO in November last year.

Who is Aakash Chaudhry? Zerodha, Zomato founders bet on Sparkl EdventureInvestors include Zomato founder Deepinder Goyal and Zerodha founder Nithin Kamath, who have backed the platform that aims to transform personalised learning for students.

Sanathan Textiles IPO allotment: Check step-by-step guide to check statusSanathan Textiles IPO: Investors can verify their allotment status through two platforms: the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the KFin Technologies portal. Here's a step-by-step guide:

Apple nears $4 trillion valuation amid AI push and iPhone upgrade hopesApple's strategic push into AI and its resilience in navigating market challenges have positioned the tech giant as a leader in the sector.
Greaves Cotton share price gains over 10% today. What's behind the rally? Greaves Cotton stock price: The company's shares were trading 10.25% higher at Rs 252.70 on the BSE at 12:18 pm.

Explained: Why Tata Investment share price jumped 12% todayTata Investment stock price: At 11:53 am, shares of the company were up 11.51% to Rs 7,284 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The surge followed reports that Tata Capital is gearing up for an initial public offering (IPO) worth Rs 15,000 crore.

Are stock markets closed on December 25? Check the full 2025 holiday scheduleOn regular weekdays, the stock market operates from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM. A pre-opening session takes place from 9:00 AM to 9:15 AM to set the tone for the trading day.

Which insurance companies reject claims the least? Report reveals truthPeople don't just put in money but trust when they buy insurance policies to cover for medical emergencies or motor accidents. A report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India reveals how many such claims have been accepted or rejected by insurance companies in 2022-23.

Carraro India IPO: Check GMP, price band and subscription statusCarraro India IPO is a Rs 1,250 crore offer for sale (OFS) consisting of 1.77 crore shares. As this is a pure OFS, the entire proceeds will go to the selling shareholders, and the company will not raise fresh capital.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Latest subscription status, GMP; listing dateSenores Pharmaceuticals IPO: The IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders.

Sagility India share price rises 5% to hit upper circuit today. Here's why Sagility India debuted on the stock market with an issue price of Rs 30 per share. At its current level, the stock has surged over 63% from the IPO price, underscoring strong investor interest.

Ventive Hospitality IPO: Check GMP as listing enters last day for biddingRetail investors must apply for a minimum of 23 shares per lot, which requires a minimum investment of Rs 14,789 for retail applicants.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as market rally loses steam; TCS gains 1% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 47.25 points to 78,587.42, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 10.80 points to 23,764.25 as of 9:30 AM.

DAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusDAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: The allotment status can be checked by investors through the websites of either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) or Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing date Mamata Machinery IPO allotment: Investors who have bid can check their allotment status online by logging in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Stocks to watch today: Wipro, Vedanta, Adani Enterprises, TVS Motor Several companies are expected to remain in focus due to recent developments. Among them are Vedanta, Prestige Estates, Wipro, Adani Enterprises, and TVS Motor.
IPOs in 2024: Big ticket listings that failed to impressRecord-breaking IPOs in India coexist with the struggles of billion-dollar listings, reflecting both market resilience and investor caution.
Sensex ends 400 points higher, Nifty jumps as heavyweight stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 498.58 points to end at 78,540.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 165.95 points to close at 23,753.45.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Champions Trophy: India vs Pakistan on February 23 as ICC announces full scheduleChampions Trophy: The ICC announced the full schedule of the Champions Trophy on Tuesday, December 24. The India vs Pakistan group stage game is set to be played on February 23. In case India qualify for the final, the match will be played in Dubai.

Local staff working at inoperative Indian post in Afghanistan attacked: SourcesAn Indian consulate vehicle was attacked in Afghanistan's Jalalabad by unknown men, injuring a staff member. Notably, the Indian Consulate in Jalalabad has remained largely non-operational since 2020.

Allu Arjun questioned for 4 hours, said knew about death next day: Sources  Live UpdatesAllu Arjun was questioned by the Hyderabad Police for four hours over the death of a 36-year-old woman in a stampede at Sandhya theatre during Pushpa 2's premiere on December 4.

Manu Bhaker breaks silence on Khel Ratna snub: Believe there's been a lapseManu Bhaker remained undeterred despite being left out of the Khel Ratna nominations. The shooter emphasised her commitment to winning medals for India, stating that while awards motivate her, they are not the ultimate goal of her journey.

Alcohol khatam, farsaan baaki: Did Gujarat-Thailand flyers hit booze limit?People on the first Air India flight from Surat to Bangkok claimed that they had polished off the entire alcohol stock on the plane. Air India Express officials refuted the claim, saying it was well-stocked. Did the passengers hit an unofficial limit on alcohol servings? Who takes such a call mid-air?

18% GST on used cars: Do you have to pay tax on selling your car?The decision has sparked debates as it comes at a time when India's used car market is poised for growth. Many believe the move aims to tap into the rapidly expanding sector to boost government revenue.

Christmas travel scare in US as American Airlines briefly grounds all flightsAmerican Airlines posted on X that they are trying to fix the problem as soon as possible, but they cannot give a timeframe as to how long it exactly would take them to restore services.

Bangladesh frees ex-minister who funded POK terrorists to bleed IndiaA Bangladesh court has freed former BNP minister Abdus Salam Pintu who helped in the recruitment and training of terrorists from Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (POK). Pintu was in jail for 17 years after being convicted in the 2004 plot to assassinate Sheikh Hasina. He helped terror outfit HuJI with funds to procure arms and train recruits.

7 Unique Christmas Traditions From Across The WorldHere are seven fascinating and unique Christmas traditions from different cultures worldwide, from festive spiders in Ukraine to the giant lanterns of the Philippines. How many did you know about?

Bengaluru techie claims he was fired 4 months after joining, blames 'toxic' bossIn a now-viral post on LinkedIn, a Bengaluru-based techie accused his 'toxic' boss of being the reason he was fired months after he joined a leading American workforce management company.

Chandigarh civic body meet turns into WWE ring over Ambedkar remarks rowThe trigger for the scuffle was a motion passed by Congress and AAP councillors demanding Union Home Minister Amit Shah's resignation over his remarks on BR Ambedkar.

Kerala Orthodox Church priest slams PM's Christmas event amid Palakkad incidentsOrthodox Church Thrissur Diocese Metropolitan Youhanon Mar Meletius criticised Prime Minister Modi's participation in Catholic Bishops' Conference of India's Christmas event, following incidents in Palakkad where VHP activists disrupted celebrations.

Aishwarya Rai's lehenga from Jodha Akbar features in The Academy's museumAishwarya Rai's iconic red wedding lehenga from Jodha Akbar is now part of the Academy Museum's exhibition. The intricately designed lehenga, featuring vibrant zardozi embroidery, highlights Indian craftsmanship.

6 injured in clash between two groups in Bhopal, stones thrown, swords brandishedTensions flared in Bhopal's Jehangirabad area as a dispute over speeding bikes escalated into a violent clash between Sikh and Muslim communities, leaving six people injured.

Which insurance companies reject claims the least? Report reveals truthPeople don't just put in money but trust when they buy insurance policies to cover for medical emergencies or motor accidents. A report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India reveals how many such claims have been accepted or rejected by insurance companies in 2022-23.
Delhi man's message for Deepinder Goyal after emotional encounter with Zomato agentIn a post on LinkedIn, a Delhi man shared an emotional story of a Zomato delivery executive that has gone viral.

Shimla transforms into white wonderland as tourists enjoy fresh snowfall | PHOTOSNestled in the serene hills of Himachal Pradesh, Shimla has turned into a postcard-perfect destination following the recent snowfall. Blanketed in pristine white, the Queen of Hills has come alive with the joy of tourists savouring the chill, walking on the white snow, and sipping hot tea amidst the picturesque landscapes. From Mall Road to Kufri, every corner is a visual delight. This photo gallery captures the essence of Shimla's snowy charm and the smiles it has brought to all.

Let the best in based on skill: Perplexity CEO backs Trump's AI czar on green cardAravind Srinivas has backed the stance of Sriram Krishnan, Donald Trump's pick as White House adviser on AI, on removing the country cap on US green cards.
Kia Syros HTK: Is it best base variant among compact SUVs? Package does not lieIn the Syros, Kia has introduced a model that offers a plethora of features, even in the base variant.

How many bouncers arranged: What Allu Arjun was asked in Pushpa 2 stampede caseAllu Arjun, who is out on bail in the case, appeared before police for questioning in connection with the stampede at Sandhya theatre that left a woman dead and her son critical.

Weathering the storm: 2024's extreme weather challenges in stunning photosA photo essay capturing incredible stories of survival and the remarkable ways communities joined hands to rebuild lives and face nature's fiercest challenges in 2024.

Integrity eroding: Congress goes to Supreme Court over election rule tweakThe government has tweaked an election rule to prevent public inspection of certain electronic documents such as CCTV camera and webcasting footage as well as video recordings of candidates to prevent their misuse.

S Jaishankar's US visit, first after Trump's presidential win: What to expectExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will be in the United States over the next few days. He is expected to meet top Indian diplomats posted in the country and brief them on reaching out to members of the incoming Donald Trump administration in the US.

Naya Bangladesh trading-off 1971 rape-murder horrors for Pakistan embrace?Bangladesh has always been demanding an "apology for the 1971 genocide" from Pakistan. But the caretaker government headed by Muhammad Yunus has now diluted the stand, calling for a "resolution of the issues". With this shift, Naya Bangladesh is erasing the horrors of 1971, when the Pakistani army killed around 400,000 Bengalis and raped thousands of women.

Siddharth Anand replaces Sujoy Ghosh as director for SRK's King: ReportsAmid much buzz around Shah Rukh Khan's King, it has now been reported that Siddharth Aand has replaced Sujoy Ghosh to direct the entertainer. The film also stars Suhana Khan in a key role.

Telugu film families: How four clans have dominated Tollywood for decades The Telugu film industry is ruled by four film families. These families are replete with actors and producers, who have also ventured into theatre business, distribution and film exhibition.

Aishwarya Rai's lehenga from Jodha Akbar features in The Academy's museumAishwarya Rai's iconic red wedding lehenga from Jodha Akbar is now part of the Academy Museum's exhibition. The intricately designed lehenga, featuring vibrant zardozi embroidery, highlights Indian craftsmanship.

BB 18's Edin Rose on criticism for being bold on TV: We were called for glamourEdin Rose shared her journey on Bigg Boss 18. The actor who was evicted from the show with Yamini Malhotra, believed that the show will boost her career.

sports.headline: Explained: Why Champions Trophy final in Dubai and not Pakistan if India qualifyChampions Trophy 2025: India will play all their matches in Dubai. If India don't reach the final, then the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore will host the title match. Pakistan will host 11 out of the 15 matches in the tournament.

Cannot grudge Shami snub vs Australia: Aakash Chopra on pacer's injuryAakash Chopra supported BCCI's decision to exclude Mohammed Shami from the Border-Gavaskar Trophy squad, citing the pacer's ongoing knee injury recovery and emphasizing the importance of not rushing him back into high-pressure international cricket.
India's full schedule for Champions Trophy 2025. All you need to knowCheckout India's full schedule for Champions Trophy 2025, including fixtures, dates and venues.

Champions Trophy: India vs Pakistan on February 23 as ICC announces full scheduleChampions Trophy: The ICC announced the full schedule of the Champions Trophy on Tuesday, December 24. The India vs Pakistan group stage game is set to be played on February 23. In case India qualify for the final, the match will be played in Dubai.

Khel Ratna snub 'humilation' might affect Manu Bhaker's progress: Coach RanaManu Bhaker's coach lashed out at the national sports bodies over the omission of Manu Bhaker's name from the list of nominees for Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award. Manu won two bronze medals in shooting at the Paris Olympics.

West Indies Test team to tour Pakistan for 1st time since 2006, announce squadAmir Jangoo earns his maiden Test call-up, while Gudakesh Motie returns as West Indies prepare for their first Test series in Pakistan since 2006. Kraigg Brathwaite leads a 15-member squad, aiming for a strong finish to the WTC cycle.

Harleen hits maiden ODI century in India's fiery batting-show vs West IndiesHarleen Deol dazzled with her maiden ODI century, leading India to their highest ODI total against West Indies. Her composed yet aggressive innings placed her alongside legends, showcasing India's batting brilliance in a dominant series display.

Smriti Mandhana jumps to 2nd spot in ODI and T20I batting rankingsSmriti Mandhana's stellar performances catapulted her to the 2nd spot in the ODI and T20I batting rankings, highlighting her consistency with five consecutive 50-plus scores. Her dominance cements her as a crucial asset in India's batting lineup.

Watch: Rohit to bowl in Melbourne Test? India skipper flaunts grip in netsRohit Sharma's viral ball-grip moment fuelled speculation about his potential role as a bowler in India's Boxing Day Test against Australia, raising excitement as the skipper aims to navigate mounting criticism over his form and leadership.

Watch: Vinod Kambli sings from hospital bed, shares positive health updateFormer India cricketer Vinod Kambli appeared emotional as he spoke to the media from a private hospital in Thane on Tuesday. The member of 1996 World Cup team was hospitalised on Saturday after his health deteriorated.

Watch: Maharashtra's Kiran Navgire hits 8 sixes en route 24-ball 64 vs RailwaysKiran Navgire played a blistering knock of 64 off 25 balls with eight sixes in the Senior Women's One-Day Trophy quarterfinal against Railways.

Hurt Shubman Gill refuses to leave nets, declared fit for MCG TestIndis batter Shubman Gill was once again copped a blow to his finger, just days ahead of the Boxing Day Test match at the MCG. However, the batter refused to leave the nets and continued his practice.

Virat Kohli looks rock solid in nets, urges fans not to make noiseBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: India star batter Virat Kohli displayed impeccable technique in the nets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground ahead of the Boxing Day Test. Kohli also urged the fans not to make noise in the practice session.

As India's Shami hopes fade, time for Bumrah's support group to step upTeam India has received a massive setback as fast bowler Mohammed Shami failed to recover in time for the last two Tests against Australia. Shami's absence will further mount the pressure on pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah, who has lacked the support from other bowlers. Will other bowlers finally step up in the remaining two Tests?

Rohit Sharma's guide to captaining Jasprit Bumrah: Don't have to say anythingIndia captain Rohit Sharma explained his guide to captaining pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah ahead of the Boxing Day Test in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Fakhar Zaman breaks silence on contract snub, clarifies controversial tweetOut of favour Pakistan batter Fakhar Zaman has broken his silence on the central contract snub. Fakhar Zaman was punished for one of his tweets in 2024, which was perceived as a criticism of the Pakistan Cricket Board.

Virat Kohli looks rock solid in nets, urges fans not to make noiseBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: India star batter Virat Kohli displayed impeccable technique in the nets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground ahead of the Boxing Day Test. Kohli also urged the fans not to make noise in the practice session.

Shami's absence will further mount the pressure on pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah, who has lacked the support from other bowlers. Will other bowlers finally step up in the remaining two Tests?

No regrets about not captaining India, but would have enjoyed it: R AshwinR Ashwin played 106 Tests and took 537 wickets, but the legendary off-spinner did not get an opportunity to lead the senior national team in the longest format of the game. Ashwin retired from international cricket on December 18.

Niki Prasad to lead India's 15-member squad for ICC U19 Women's T20 World CupNiki Prasad will lead India's strong 15-member squad for the ICC U19 Women's T20 World Cup, scheduled in Malaysia from January 18 to February 2, 2025. Niki led India to a title win at the inaugural ACC U19 Women's Asia Cup in Kuala Lumpur.

Manchester United manager questions Rashford camp over new challenge commentsManchester United boss Ruben Amorim has questioned the decision-making of individuals close to forward Marcus Rashford, who has been absent from the team's last three games.

3 losses in 14 years: Breaking down Australia's recent record at the MCGAustralia will take on India in the Boxing Day Test match at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. The iconic 'G' has been a traditional stronghold of Australia, but the hosts have struggled against India at the venue in the recent past.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
